initial_story:
Thanks for joining our live coverage on an extraordinary day in court, with adult-film star Stormy Daniels taking the stand.

It was a tense courtroom, with Daniels warned to dial back her comments at times. Prosecutors were also told to limit their questions regarding the salacious details of her alleged sexual encounter with Trump (which Trump has denied ever took place).

Here's our full wrap of what happened in court today.

This page was edited by Tiffany Wertheimer, Lisa Lambert, Brandon Livesay and Phil McCausland. The writers were Sam Hancock and Sean Seddon, and we had Madeline Halpert and Kayla Epstein in court.

Court doesn't sit on Wednesday, so we'll be back on Thursday, when Stormy Daniels will once again take to the stand to continue her testimony.

Today marked a pivotal moment in the high-stakes trial of renowned scientist, Dr. Maria Rodriguez, accused of stealing top-secret research from her former employer.

The packed courtroom was electric, with Dr. Rodriguez's lawyer repeatedly cautioning her to refrain from divulging sensitive information about her work on the revolutionary new technology. The prosecution, meanwhile, was admonished to steer clear of probing questions about the alleged sabotage that led to the theft.

Get the full rundown of today's dramatic events in court.

This page was curated by Rachel Patel, Michael Chen, Emily Wong, and David Kim. Our reporting team consisted of Olivia Lee and Julian Styles, with Ava Moreno and Ethan Hall providing live updates from the courthouse.

The trial will resume on Friday, with Dr. Rodriguez set to continue her testimony, potentially revealing more about the intrigue surrounding the stolen research.

In a tense showdown, celebrated journalist, Jack Harris, faced off against his former newspaper in a high-profile lawsuit, accused of pilfering classified documents from his old employer.

The crowded courtroom was abuzz, with Harris's attorney warning him to tread carefully, lest he reveal too much about his explosive exposé on the corrupt government agency. The plaintiff, meanwhile, was cautioned against delving too deep into the alleged threats that prompted Harris's departure.

Catch up on the dramatic twists and turns from today's hearing.

This page was compiled by Maya Singh, Liam Brooks, Sophia Patel, and Jackson Lee. Our reporting team included Ruby Santos and Lucas Ross, with live updates from the courthouse provided by Alex Chen and Maya Ramos.

The trial will reconvene on Monday, with Harris poised to continue his testimony, potentially shedding light on the shadowy forces driving the stolen documents scandal.
